message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product at a price that I think is fair. I'm willing to start at $14,000. This is a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love the product.
Thanks for the offer, Alice. That price is a little too high for me.  I'd be willing to pay $10,000 for the product.

I understand you're looking for a better deal, Bob. However, I need to make a profit on this sale. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $12,500. This is the lowest I can go, and I'm confident you'll find it a fair price.
I appreciate you meeting me a bit lower, Alice.  How about we split the difference between our last two offers?  Would you be willing to do $11,250?

I appreciate your creative suggestion, Bob, but I'm not quite ready to meet you at $11,250. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price. I'm now offering the product to you for $12,500 is too high, so I'll offer it to you for $13,000. This is my final concession, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.
